sen.j: 京都サンガF.C.（きょうとサンガエフシー、Kyoto Sanga FC）は、日本の京都市にホームを置く、日本プロサッカーリーグ（Jリーグ）に加盟するプロサッカークラブ。
sen.e: Kyoto Sanga F.C. (京都サンガF.C.) is a professional football (soccer) club which is based in Kyoto City, Japan, and is affiliated with the Japan Professional Football League (J. League for short).

sen.j: 前身は1922年設立の京都紫光クラブ（設立時の名称は紫郊クラブ）でJリーグ所属のチームとしては日本最古。
sen.e: The original club was established as Kyoto Shiko Club (京都紫光クラブ, of which 紫光 means purple light, and the name was at first put down as 紫郊クラブ) in 1922, and is the oldest team belonging to J. League in Japan.

sen.j: 1993年に「教育研究社FC京都パープルサンガ」（翌1994年にサンガの練習生を中心に結成したチーム「FC京都BAMB1993を分離）とアマチュアの「京都紫光クラブ」に分割した。
sen.e: In 1993, the club was divided into two teams: one was "Kyoikukenkyusha FC Kyoto Purple Sanga" (from which "FC Kyoto BAMB 1993" was separated in the next year, 1994, which was organized mainly by the trainees of Sanga), and the other was amateur "Kyoto Shiko Club".

sen.e: In that enthusiasm, the demand for "organizing a J. League team in Kyoto" had increased, and "the Association for organizing a J. League team in Kyoto" collected about 250,000 signatures.

sen.e: As a result of those movements, in January of the next year, 1994, an operating company "Kyocera Purple Sanga Corporation" was established with the investments by the local businesses such as Kyocera Corporation and Nintendo Co., Ltd. as the main sponsors, and in July of the same year, the company obtained approval for J. League Associate Membership, so a J. League team was ready to be born in Kyoto which would be the hometown of the team.

sen.e: The club did not go on doing nothing against the present state of things, and made a lot of possible efforts to become a community-based club: for example, holding football schools, making the players participate in Kumin Matsuri (district festivals, which differ in names according to administrative districts, such as "Fureai Matsuri") opened in each administrative district of Kyoto City including Kyoto Matsuri (Kyoto Festival), and giving the presentation of the new uniform at Kyoto Nishiki Food Market called the Kitchen of Kyo.

sen.e: But while the plan to utilize the premises of Kyoto City Yokooji Sports Park was considered at first, on June 26, 2006 "Committee for consideration on a football stadium" (the chairman was Yasushi MATSUYAMA, Kyosho Kyoto Sports Promotion Special Committee Chairman) made public the final report that said "carrying out that plan will be difficult" because of the problems with the traffic access and the budget for construction.

sen.e: As a result of that, it was decided that they realize a plan called Scholar-Athlete Project to which Japan has ever had no parallel, and in which Kyocera Corporation in the industry, the Ritsumeikan Academy in the education, and Kyoto Sanga F.C. in the civilian cooperate with one another to train excellent persons who will be accepted in the world.

sen.e: According to the plan, students of the senior high school generation study at Ritsumeikan Uji High School, practice playing football in the artificial grass ground (lighting full-equipped) dedicated to the cultivation organization in Sanga Town Joyo, and live in a dormitory built by Kyoto Sanga F.C.
